question_sentence: Which state was impacted by targeted gun attacks on power substations this week, leaving around 45,000 people in the dark?
evidence: Two substations in Moore County, North Carolina, were damaged by gunfire. The primary utility company in the county was able to restore power to residents after about four days without electricity.

question_sentence: Democratic Sen. Raphael Warnock won Georgia’s Senate runoff this week, defeating Republican challenger Herschel Walker. Prior to leaping into politics, which sport did Herschel Walker play professionally?
evidence: Herschel Walker, who played college football at the University of Georgia, spent 12 seasons in the NFL. He later launched his Senate campaign with an endorsement from former President Donald Trump.

question_sentence: Authorities in Hawaii are concerned that lava from the Mauna Loa volcano eruption could soon reach which type of infrastructure?
evidence: The lava is less than two miles from reaching the Daniel K. Inouye Highway – the major highway connecting the eastern and western halves of the Big Island. If this occurs, it will cause major travel delays, but experts say it is unlikely that Mauna Loa’s lava will wipe out homes; the closest major population center is about 37 miles away.

question_sentence: Actor Bob McGrath died this week at age 90. Which beloved children’s show did he appear on for 47 seasons?
evidence: McGrath played the friendly neighbor Bob Johnson as an original cast member of “Sesame Street.” He joined the show in 1969. McGrath peacefully died at home, surrounded by loved ones, his family shared in a statement this week.

question_sentence: Which slang term was selected as Oxford’s word of the year for 2022?
evidence: The term “Goblin mode” was selected by 93% of people in a public poll, racking up nearly 320,000 votes. It refers to a type of behavior that is “unapologetically self-indulgent, lazy, slovenly, or greedy, typically in a way that rejects social norms or expectations.”

question_sentence: Which company recently cut ties with basketball star Kyrie Irving?
evidence: Nike has parted ways with Irving after the basketball player shared a link to a documentary containing antisemitic messages in October and initially refused to issue an apology.

question_sentence: Which country recently scrapped some of its most controversial Covid-19 rules that prompted protests across the country?
evidence: China unveiled 10 new guidelines that loosen some Covid restrictions – most notably, allowing home quarantine and phasing out the health QR code that has been mandatory for entering most public places.

question_sentence: More than 1,100 journalists and other staffers went on strike at which major newspaper this week?
evidence: New York Times journalists staged a historic 24-hour strike after management and the union representing staffers failed to reach a deal.

question_sentence: Dina Boluarte took office Wednesday to become the first female president of which country?
evidence: Dina Boluarte became the new president — and first female president — of Peru after the country’s Congress ousted former president Pedro Castillo.

question_sentence: Who was named TIME magazine’s person of the year for 2022?
evidence: Volodymyr Zelensky, the Ukrainian leader whose attempt to fight off Russia’s invasion of his country has won widespread acclaim, was named TIME magazine’s person of the year, alongside “the spirit of Ukraine.”

question_sentence: Aaron Judge agreed to re-sign with the New York Yankees this week, with a 9-year contract worth how much?
Democrat Raphael Warnock defeated Republican Herschel Walker in the Georgia Senate run-off. His win gives Democrats how many Senate seats?
Who was named Time’s 2022 Person of the Year this week?
Which of these people weren’t one of Google’s 10 top trending actor searches in 2022?
Rob Glass is the first football strength coach to eclipse an annual salary of $1 million at a public school. Where does he coach?
Brittney Griner was released from a Russian penal colony after a prisoner exchange for arms dealer Viktor Bout. How long was Griner detained?
“Harry & Meghan,” a docuseries centered on the Duke and Duchess of Sussex, was released this week on which streaming platform?
The U.S. House Committee on Ethics is investigating a complaint concerning which representative?
Which virus is not included in the “tripledemic” that remains a problem in many places?
The House passed historic legislation this week that would federally protect same-sex and interracial marriage rights. What is it called?
What is the nickname of World Cup quarter-finalists Morocco?
evidence: Morocco knocked out Spain (3-0 on penalties) to reach the World Cup quarter-final. They face Portugal tomorrow.

question_sentence: The Oxford English Dictionary has named which word or phrase as its “word of the year”?
evidence: The Oxford English Dictionary defines goblin mode as “a type of behaviour which is unapologetically self-indulgent, lazy, slovenly, or greedy, typically in a way that rejects social norms or expectations”.

question_sentence: What is the average yearly pay for an author in the UK, according to a new report?
evidence: In 2006, the median earnings from self-employed writing was £12,330, but that has fallen by 60%, according to a report by the Authors’ Licensing and Collecting Society.

question_sentence: What is the average yearly pay for an author in the UK, according to a new report?
evidence: In 2006, the median earnings from self-employed writing was £12,330, but that has fallen by 60%, according to a report by the Authors’ Licensing and Collecting Society.

question_sentence: New York City mayor Eric Adams is looking for a citizen with “a general aura of badassery” in order to fill which vital role?
evidence: The city is advertising for a “somewhat bloodthirsty” person comfortable with “wholesale slaughter” to become its director of rodent mitigation – dubbed the  “rat czar” by some newspapers. The salary range is $120,000 to $170,000.

question_sentence: Where was the EU-Western Balkans summit held this week?
evidence: Despite constructive talks between the EU and the six countries outside the bloc, concrete progress on joining the EU remained elusive at the day-long summit in Tirana.

question_sentence: Which former PM hit the headlines this week with their plan for constitutional reform?
evidence: Brown’s 40-point plan for overhauling the constitution has been a labour of love since 2020 when he was first commissioned by Labour leader Keir Starmer.

question_sentence: Ukrainian embassies across the world have received packages containing which grizzly item?
evidence: There have been 31 “suspicious or threatening” items sent to embassies in 15 countries. Ukraine’s foreign minister initially pointed the finger of blame at Moscow, but Kyiv now believes the packages may have originated from Germany.

question_sentence: How many people of working age in the UK are currently “economically inactive” according to data from the Office for National Statistics?
evidence: The figures mean that around one in five of the working-age population is not currently in work. Around 2.5m people reported long-term sickness as the main reason for economic inactivity, up from around 2m in 2019.

question_sentence: Which two former cabinet members announced they were stepping down at the next UK general election?
evidence: The pair are two of a number of younger Conservative MPs and former rising stars of the party who have announced their decision to stand down amid poor polling for the Conservatives.

question_sentence: Which world-famous Manchester music venue is at risk of closure following a noise complaint by a neighbour?
evidence: The venue is appealing a noise abatement notice, which was served after a neighbour in an adjoining flat to the venue complained about loud music being played into the early hours of the morning.
